heif.boxes

Class ItemLocationBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • heif.boxes.Box
      • heif.boxes.FullBox
        • heif.boxes.ItemLocationBox

  • public class ItemLocationBox
extends FullBox
    The ItemLocationBox class handles the HEIF Box identified as iloc (Item Location Box).

    This box provides a directory of item resources, either in the same file or in external files. Each entry describes the item's container, offset within that container, and length.

    For technical details, refer to the specification document: ISO/IEC 14496-12:2015, pages 77–80.

    API Note: Additional testing is required to validate the reliability and robustness of this implementation.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      • getBaseOffsetSize

        public int getBaseOffsetSize()

      • getOffsetSize

        public int getOffsetSize()

        Returns:
        the size in bytes of the offset field

        public int getLengthSize()

      • logBoxInfo

        public void logBoxInfo()
        Logs the box hierarchy and internal entry data at the debug level.

        It provides a visual representation of the box's HEIF/ISO-BMFF structure. It is intended for tree traversal and file inspection during development and degugging if required.

        Overrides:
        logBoxInfo in class FullBox

      • readSizedValue

        private long readSizedValue(int bytesize,
                            ByteStreamReader reader)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a value from the stream based on the specified size indicator.
        • 0 – value is always zero (no bytes read)
        • 4 – reads a 4-byte unsigned integer
        • 8 – reads an 8-byte unsigned integer

        Important note: the data read follows the Big-Endian format

        Parameters:
        bytesize - the number of bytes to read: {0, 4, 8}
        reader - the ByteStreamReader object needed for reading the value
        Returns:
        the parsed value as an unsigned long
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input is not one of {0, 4, 8}
